revised_title: Inoculation Practices in Arabia and the Middle East
tldr: This article discusses the practice of inoculation against smallpox in various regions of the Middle East, including Arabia, Turkey, and Armenia. The author, Dr. Patrick Russell, shares his observations and experiences with the practice, which was known as "buying the smallpox" among the local populations. The article highlights the widespread use of inoculation among different Arab tribes and communities, as well as the varying methods and beliefs surrounding the practice.
